duties_responsibilities.duty: Performs individualized nursing care for patients/families under the direction of an RN.
Uses and practices basic assessment data collection, participates in planning, executes interventions in accordance with the Plan Of Care and contributes to evaluation of outcomes.
Communicates to ensure patient/family educated Plan Of Care and planned treatments.
Documents assessment data collected and communicates/contributes data to RN for analysis and interpretation.
Coordinates patient care activities, workflow, and patient progress with other healthcare team members.
Implements plan of care per department guidelines and refers practices outside of scope to RN.
Gives constructive feedback to peers regarding work performance and notifies supervisor of suspected performance issues.
Encourages patient and family participation in decision making and acts to uphold individual/family rights.
Identifies learning needs including barriers/readiness and recognizes barriers to communication with patient and family.
Demonstrates understanding of patient/family goals and makes recommendations to the multidisciplinary team in development of the patient's plan of care.
Updates written plan of care per direction of RN and collects data indicative of patient/family response to care per department guidelines.
Reports data/information to team members in determining the need to alter goals and interventions and contributes observations and data to patient care conferences.

education_certification.credential: 1 Year LVN experience in an acute care setting or related area.AHA Basic Life Support for Healthcare Professional (AHA BLS Healthcare) - American Heart Association -REQUIREDCalifornia Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN) - CA Board of Vocational Nursing & Psychiatric Technicians -REQUIRED
